title: New Orleans Pelicans rookie Zion Williamson expected to miss start of season
text:
USA TODAY

Zion Williamson's NBA debut will likely be delayed.

The No. 1 overall pick and enthralling prospect is expected to be sidelined for the start of the regular season, including the New Orleans Pelicans' opener against Toronto on Tuesday, a person with knowledge of the situation told USA TODAY Sports. The person spoke under the condition of anonymity because Williamson's injury status had not yet been officially announced.

The Pelicans said in a news release Thursday that Williamson will miss the team's final preseason game — Friday night against the Knicks in New York — with right knee soreness, and that he stayed behind in New Orleans to undergo further testing.

Tests revealed that Williamson avoided a major injury, according to the person.

Williamson averaged 27.3 minutes per game in four preseason contests, with 23.3 points and 6.5 rebounds.

It's the same knee that Williamson sprained during his lone season at Duke, when his sneaker gave out moments into the Blue Devils' matchup against rival North Carolina.
description: No. 1 overall pick Zion Williamson is expected to be sidelined for the start of the NBA regular season.
